title: Vikings torture with Travis Fimmel photos: Will Ragnar return for finale?
text:
Vikings are torturing us with Ragnar photos (Picture: History)

Vikings have tortured fans ahead of the final season with the most heart-wrenching throwback of Travis Fimmel as Ragnar Lothbrok, and, honestly, what are they doing to us?

We now finally have a release date for the last chapter of Vikings after showrunner Michael Hirst confirmed the History epic had wrapped up but could return with several spin-offs.

What those spin-offs could entail remains to be seen, but instead of looking forward fans have been reflecting on the wild ruler of Kattegat, and with reflection comes an onslaught of tears.

Alongside photos of Ragnar and his Queen Lagertha (played by Katheryn Winnick) dreaming of their future together, the Vikings Instagram wrote: ‘On this Thor’s Day, we reflect upon Kattegat and the exploits of legendary Ragnar Lothbrok and his crew of Viking warriors. Ragnar’s quest to become Earl was relentless.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And, his desire to raid England was voracious. But, with victory came loss. If you could ask Odin to change the course of history, what would it be? Or is it “sometimes better not to know one’s fate.”’

Understandably, the post proved too much with the comments compiling of more broken heart emojis than any actual words.

‘Still not remotely over Ragnar’s death,’ and ‘I MISS RAGNAR SO MUCH,’ kicked things off, while a particularly devastated fan cried: ‘Bring back Ragnar!’

Another agreed: ‘Make Ragnar come back alive!!!’

Despite various rumblings on Reddit Ragnar could return dead or alive, Hirst confirmed Bjorn’s (Alexander Ludwig) vision would be the last time we’d ever see his father or any of the ghosts from the past five seasons.

‘It’s not really the kind of show where I bring dead people back particularly,’ he told Variety. ‘So it was always going to be Bjorn’s intense flashback to that very significant moment in his life, when Ragnar tried to tell him things about power.

‘The thing is, whatever someone tells you, the reality is you have to learn these things for yourself.’

As for what’s in store, we now have a brutal new trailer which lays it all out here:

Vikings returns to History Channel on December 4.

description: Vikings torture with Travis Fimmel photos: Will Ragnar return for finale? ‘Bring back Ragnar!’
